name: CryptoParty, February 9th, Northeastern Law School
tagline: Encryption tools for files and messaging
body:
## TrueCrypt
Free open-source disk encryption software for Windows 7/Vista/XP, Mac OS X, and Linux.

* Creates a virtual encrypted disk within a file and mounts it as a real disk. 

* Encrypts an entire partition or storage device such as USB flash drive or hard drive.

* Can encrypt a partition or drive where Windows is installed (pre-boot authentication).

* Provides plausible deniability, in case an adversary forces you to reveal the password (hidden volume or operating system).

[Is TrueCrypt Audited Yet?](http://istruecryptauditedyet.com/)

### [Download](http://www.truecrypt.org/downloads)

## FileVault
Provided by Apple on Mac operating systems, under System Preferences → Security & Privacy.

* [FileVault 1](http://support.apple.com/kb/ph7031): available in OS X versions 10.3 to 10.6. Encrypts a user's home directory.

* [FileVault 2](http://support.apple.com/kb/ht4790): OS X Lion (10.7) and later. Full disk, XTS-AES 128 encryption.

* Some performance degradation is inevitable.

## [BitLocker](http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows7/products/features/bitlocker)
Provided by Microsoft on Windows 7 Ultimate and Enterprise Edition, under Control Panel → System and Security

## [LUKS](https://code.google.com/p/cryptsetup/)
Linux Unified Key Setup

* Standard for Linux hard disk encryption.

* Included in the installer of many modern distributions.

* Cryptsetup utility, based on dm-crypt kernel module, supports plain dm-crypt volumes, LUKS, loop-AES and TrueCrypt formats.

Example:
```
$ apt-get install cryptsetup
$ cryptsetup luksFormat /dev/sda1
$ cryptsetup luksOpen /dev/sda1 data
$ mkfs.ext4 /dev/mapper/data
$ mount -t ext4 /dev/mapper/data /media/data
$ update-initramfs -u
```
Also check out [eCryptfs](http://ecryptfs.org/).

## Off-the-record messaging (OTR)
Popular protocol for encryption, authentication, deniability, and perfect forward secrecy of instant messaging.

[Adium](https://adium.im/) for Mac OS X

[Pidgin](http://pidgin.im/) with [pidgin-otr](https://otr.cypherpunks.ca/) plugin (Windows and Linux)

###Mobile
Android: [Xabber](http://www.xabber.org/) or ChatSecure

iPhone: [ChatSecure](https://chatsecure.org/)

## Secure calls and texts

Get RedPhone and TextSecure for Android, both from [Open Whisper Systems](https://whispersystems.org/). Coming soon to iPhone.

## Recommended browser extensions

[HTTPS Everywhere](https://www.eff.org/https-everywhere) tells your browser to always request a secure connection if it's available.

[Ghostery](https://www.ghostery.com/) reveals invisible trackers embedded in pages.

[Disconnect](https://disconnect.me/) is similar to above.

[Lightbeam](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/lightbeam/) also reveals invisible trackers, for Firefox only.

[AdBlock Plus](https://adblockplus.org/) blocks banners, pop-ups and video ads.

[CryptoCat](https://crypto.cat/) offers easy to use and accessible encrypted chat, as a browser app.

[Mailvelope](http://www.mailvelope.com/) provides OpenPGP encryption for Google and Yahoo webmail.

[DoNotTrackMe, MaskMe, and DeleteMe](https://abine.com/products/index.php) tools from Abine, Inc. based here in Boston.

[DuckDuckGo](https://duckduckgo.com/) is a privacy-friendly alternative to Google search.

## Backups

[SpiderOak](https://spideroak.com/) and [CrashPlan](http://www.code42.com/crashplan/) are both encryption-friendly backup services.

## Stuff to watch

I'm excited about things like [SecureDrop](https://pressfreedomfoundation.org/securedrop), [LEAP Encryption Access Project](https://pressfreedomfoundation.org/organization/leap-encryption-access-project), [mailpile](https://www.mailpile.is/), the [Dark Mail Technical Alliance](http://darkmail.info/), [GlobalLeaks](https://globaleaks.org/), [ownCloud](http://owncloud.org/), [Pond](https://pond.imperialviolet.org/), [Bitmessage](https://bitmessage.org/wiki/Main_Page) and [Enigmabox](http://enigmabox.net/en/)!
